oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Chet Atkins Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1985 Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Chet Atkins. The recording takes place on 03-04-85.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:04) -- Chet Atkins continues discussion about overdubbing. (0:59) -- Chet Atkins mentions that he often records 8 bars of music at a time. (2:08) -- "I tend to play something a lot better the first time I play it anyway. The longer I play it, the worse I get." - Chet Atkins about recording. (2:34) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about whether his friends use his personal home studio. (3:22) -- Chet Atkins discusses rehearsing for shows and preparing for recording sessions. (3:45) -- Chet Atkins mentions that he does about 30-40 shows a year. (4:24) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins what music he listens to in his spare time. Chet mentions Art Tatum (jazz piano player). (6:14) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about his consulting work with guitar companies (Gibson). (9:11) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about his future projects. (9:57) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins if he is currently designing a new guitar. (12:02) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about sessions with George Benson. (13:14) -- Chet Atkins describes his road band. (14:55) -- Chet Atkins describes promotion plans for the album "Stay Tuned." (15:53) -- Bob Allen asks about how Chet Atkins get his signature sound when recording. "Nah, there's nothing special I do, I'm always searching..and trying to find a better sound." - Chet Atkins (19:59) -- Bob Allen asks about Chet Atkins' piano player's equipment. (20:39) -- Chet Atkins discusses his home instrument collection. (21:54) -- Chet Atkins mentions Rick Blackburn's interest in "Stay Tuned." (24:10) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about his producing work. Chet Atkins says he's working with Roger Whittaker. (25:10) -- Chet Atkins discusses the difficulties of producing. Chet briefly mentions dealing with managers who tried to interfere with his creative process. (27:45) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about the changes in the Nashville music scene.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Atkins, Chet;
